definition: to fall sick/to contract an illness
to do harm to/to cause trouble to/harm/evil/calamity

sentences.english: This is while he was been ill these days.
sentences.chinese: 這是由於他這些天不絕在害病。

sentences.english: People drink realgar wine to protect themselves from illness.
sentences.chinese: 人們喝雄黃侍者護本身免於害病。

sentences.english: I was ill because of the hot weather.
sentences.chinese: 我害病是因爲很熱的氣候。

sentences.english: After all it was a ruse of the Thenardiers to obtain money. Cosette was not ill.
sentences.chinese: 那卻是德納第夫婦謀財的騙局，珂賽特並沒有害病。

sentences.english: 2There a centurion's servant, whom his master valued highly, was sick and about to die.
sentences.chinese: 有一個百夫長所寶貴的僕人，害病快要死了。

sentences.english: This is because he was been ill these days.
sentences.chinese: 這是因爲他這些天一直在害病。

sentences.english: If you eat too much, you'll get ill.
sentences.chinese: 不要喫患上太多，否則你會實義德害病的。

definition: to fall ill/to contract a disease
to catch an illness/to get infected with a disease
to fall ill and die/to die of illness
to fall gravely ill, never to recover (idiom)
old illness recurs (idiom); a relapse/fig. to repeat an old error/the same old problem
to prevent or treat a disease
